entities: International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals
summary:
The Security Council:

Reaffirms its determination to combat impunity for international crimes and ensure that all persons indicted by the International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia are brought to justice.

 Takes note of letters from the Secretary-General and the President of the International Tribunal, and recalls its previous resolutions, including 827 (1993), 1503 (2003), 1534 (2004), and 1966 (2010), which established the International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals.

 Requests the International Tribunal to complete its work and facilitate the closure of the Tribunal as expeditiously as possible, with the aim of completing the transition to the Mechanism, and expresses concern over delays in the conclusion of the Tribunal's work.

 Underlines that States should cooperate fully with the International Tribunal and the Mechanism.

 Decides to extend the terms of office of certain judges at the International Tribunal: 

- Patrick Robinson (Jamaica) until 31 July 2015 or until completion of assigned cases.
- Other listed judges until 31 December 2015 or until completion of assigned cases.

 Decides to reappoint Mr. Serge Brammertz as Prosecutor of the International Tribunal for a term from 1 January 2015 to 31 December 2015.

 Urges the Tribunal to redouble its efforts to review and shorten projected case completion dates, in light of resolution 1966 (2010).

 Decides to remain seized of the matter.
